name: GCDC Pune Kick-off Meetup

venue.name: CoHive Co-working Space,
venue.address_1: Dnyanvatsal Commercial Complex, Above Hotel Marathi Bana, Karve Road, Karve Nagar

description:
Welcome to Google Cloud Group, a new Pune-focused community to nurture and extend knowledge of Cloud Technologies with developers in Pune. Considering the potential and reach of cloud technologies and Pune’s large developer base, a Cloud-focused community can be a great value-add to developers.

Calling out all Pune-based developers to set the foundation of Google Cloud Group (GCG) Pune. Creating a thriving developers community needs strong set of guidelines and a group of highly motivated developers, evangelist and cloud experts.

The first kick-off meeting is a round-table discussion to understand the current state of cloud developers in Pune, figure out the missing gaps and create roadmap for an open and public community focused on Cloud. Looking forward to see you all!

name: Google Cloud Next Extended

venue.name: CoHive Co-working Space,
venue.address_1: Dnyanvatsal Commercial Complex, Above Hotel Marathi Bana, Karve Road, Karve Nagar

description:
Google Cloud Next Extended [Intro to Kubernetes]

GCDC Pune brings all the excitement and fun from the Global Cloud Next Event happening in San Francisco on July 24.

Let’s come together and discuss how the cloud is transforming business, making artificial intelligence available to everyone, and improving the lives and circumstances of people around the world.

The agenda for Cloud Next Extended - Pune Edition is organized to introduce the audience with Kubernetes. The introductory talks will help you get started with Kubernetes while the Codelabs will be full of hands-on practice with Kubernetes and Google Cloud’s fundamental tools and services.

Tentative agenda:

- Keynote - Google Cloud Next
- Introduction to GCP [Talk]
- Introduction to Kubernetes [Talk]
- Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud [Codelab]
- Hello Node Kubernetes [Codelab]
- Set Up Network and HTTP Load Balancers [Codelab]

Date: August 4, 2018. 1 pm onwards
Venue: will be announced shortly

Watch this space for more updates

name: GDG DevFest: Pune 2018
description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

DevFest covers multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, Mobile Web & much more!

GDG Pune in association with WTM Pune, as a part of global event series, invites you all to come together and celebrate our yearly grand celebration in this 6th consecutive year with us!

As an attendee, you can expect speaker sessions, study jams, networking, fun activities and more.

The registrations will considered here: https://goo.gl/forms/QfLvme0pGQZv0G483
It is mandatory for interested participants to fill the form. Shortlisted candidates shall be notified by e-mail.

To stay connected for more exciting content, find us here:
https://www.facebook.com/gdgpune/
Volunteer Interest form : https://goo.gl/forms/AlKdXHXAJOtiqv903
GDG Pune Twitter Handle : @GDGPune
GCDC Pune Twitter : @GCDCPune

name: GCDC Cloud Q’n’A

venue.name: CoHive Co-working Space,
venue.address_1: Dnyanvatsal Commercial Complex, Above Hotel Marathi Bana, Karve Road, Karve Nagar

description:
GCDC Cloud Q’n’A

As a developer, you might not find all the answers and tutorials on StackOverFlow or the all mighty Google, you need an expert help to find answers to your problems.
Finding a developer that shares same vision and passion can help in narrowing down the focus.

Google Cloud Developer Community : Pune is a group of enthusiasts, experts, and developers of all skill levels.
Q’n’A sessions are a simple way to co-learn, and collaborate.
Cloud Q’n’A is an attempt to bring the Cloud Developers and Experts under one platform to help each other.

Questions:

If you have specific question/query or some problem that you are stuck with, please fill the following form. The questions will be filtered at our end. These questions will be answered by a panel experts on the event day. If there is a necessity to demonstrate the solution, the experts will write the code and share with those asking questions.

Experts:

We are rolling out this form calling for all developers who have extensive experience working on cloud technologies. The idea is to create a library of expert developers that can collaborate and share their knowledge. There is no better reward than sharing the expertise and knowledge.

Questions form link: https://goo.gl/forms/78AqnwIfTzVm14U33

Experts form link: https://goo.gl/forms/ctoY1HyWS8aLPzzH2

name: Google Cloud Study Jam
description:
To provide developers an opportunity to stay ahead of the curve, we are happy to introduce Cloud Study Jams. Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers. This is a great opportunity to bring members of the community together to learn something in person. These trainings give developers a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

With a Cloud Study Jam, developers will learn the fundamental tools and capabilities of Google Cloud. Developers will be enhanced with our expert's knowledge on Kubernetes.
As a developer in the study jam, you stand to get free access to:
1. Free access to Qwiklabs Quest (worth $55).
2. Google Cloud Badge from Qwiklabs on completion of codelabs.
3. Hands-on experience on Google Cloud Platform.
4. Upgrade your skills in Kubernetes.
Form link : http://bit.ly/2GEr9p2 (Mandatory to fill the form to partcipate in the event)

Speaker Details :
Speaker Name : Mriyam Tamuli
Twitter : @mbtamuli
GitHub : https://github.com/mbtamuli

Study Material : Definitely go through these: (30 min)
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JSLpG_spOBM
2. https://stackoverflow.com/a/16048358
3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ht22ReBjno
4. https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/kubernetes-comic/

Good to know: (2 hr 30 min)
1. https://jvns.ca/blog/2016/10/10/what-even-is-a-container/
2. https://ericchiang.github.io/post/containers-from-scratch/
3. https://merrigrove.blogspot.com/2015/10/visualizing-docker-containers-and-images.html
4. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cYsVvV1aVss
5. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HlAXp0-M6SY
6. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WwBdNXt6wO4

Additional resources:
1. https://blog.jayway.com/2015/03/21/a-not-very-short-introduction-to-docker/
2. https://github.com/veggiemonk/awesome-docker
3. https://github.com/ramitsurana/awesome-kubernetes

Note :
1. We appreciate the enthusiasm of students, however we recommend this event for industry experts who wish to get started with the concept of Kubernetes.
2. An email of confirmation will be sent to the registered participants.
3. By registering for the event, you abide the undertaking that : Participant Undertaking

To : Venue Sponsor (Webonise Lab, Pune)
Date : 24th February 2019, 9 am - 6pm.
Topic : Cloud Study Jam.
Event Host : (GDG Pune) in association with WTM Pune and powered by GCDC Pune.
Study Jam will use qwiklabs (which needs Browser)
I would be attending the above Study Jam. Since, I would be using the internet of the venue, I would adhere to below Standard Best Practices and take full responsibility for using internet and will NOT engage in any of below activities:
Use any unlicensed/illegal/ pirated software.
Hacking into unauthorised websites
Introducing malicious software onto the company network and/or jeopardising the security of the organisation's electronic communications systems
Sending or posting chain letters, solicitations, or advertisements not related to study jam purposes or activities

Thank you !

We request you to be present 30 minutes prior to the event with fully charged laptops and internet connection(if available).

name: TensorFlow Summit - Viewing Party Followed by Google Cloud Study Jam 2nd Edition
description:
After successful execution of Cloud Study Jam first edition on Kubernetes, we are all excited to host TensorFlow viewing party followed by Cloud Study Jam second edition (Machine Learning) on 16th and 17th March, 2019.

The basic idea is to bring the developers together having common interests in TensorFlow, Machine Learning and Google Cloud.

We're thrilled to announce that Google is hosting the TensorFlow Dev Summit which will take place on March 6-7, 2019 Google Event Center Sunnyvale, California USA.
GDG Pune is hosting an extended event for the same. We will watch the keynote, lightning talk and discuss the case studies presented at the TensorFlow Dev Summit.

After viewing the keynote of TF Dev Summit, post lunch there will be session on Google Cloud Study Jams second edition (Machine Learning).

Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers. This is a great opportunity to bring members of the community together to get their hands dirty with Cloud Computing and learn something in person. These trainings give developers a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

With Cloud Study Jam, developers will learn the fundamental tools and capabilities of Google Cloud. Developers will be enhanced with our expert's knowledge on Machine Learning.

As a developer in the study jam, you stand to get free access to:
1. Free access to Qwiklabs Quest (worth $55).
2. Google Cloud Badge from Qwiklabs on completion of codelabs.
3. Hands-on experience on Google Cloud Platform.
4. Upgrade your skills in Machine Learning.

The event will be conducted on Saturday and Sunday.

Bring a laptop (fully charged, will have limited power sockets).
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.
For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

This is an exclusive event mainly for developers having relevant work experience and it is mandatory for interested participants to fill the form.

Registration link : http://bit.ly/CloudStudyJams

Shortlisted candidates shall be notified by e-mail.

Agenda:

Day 1
Registration
TensorFlow viewing party
Lunch Break
Cloud study jam 2nd edition (ML)

Day2
Cloud Study Jam 2nd edition
(Remaining sessions)
Lunch Break
QA and Feedback
End of Study Jam

Note: Unfortunately RSVP on the Meetup page does not guarantee entry to the event and it is mandatory for interested participants to fill up the registration form.

We are looking forward to meeting you soon!

Regards,
GDG, WTM and GCDC Pune team.
